result.execSummary:
The defendant Ian Flaws was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ian Flaws is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ian Flaws was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Ian Flaws was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Ian Flaws was found guilty of Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Each count concur. Count 5 left open for successful completion of probation.

miscConds.notes: Paid by bond. $200 DNA surcharge remitted.
Psychiatric/psychological evaluation as deemed appropriate by agent and treatment as recommended.

Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with SP, JS or WH. Def shall not be on the 300 to 500 block of West Dayton St or on King St including Madison's bar.  Defendant not to use or possess any weapon. Def shall not live in any residence where a firearm is located. Def shall not consume alcohol. Def shall not be at any residence occupied by or in visual proximity of SP.

GPS Monitoring. If def has no new arrests rising to level of probable cause, completes all treatment recommended by agent, has no ATR's and no revocation of probation, the State would not oppose a motion to dismiss count 5.
All other conditions are the same as count 2.
All other conditions are the same as count 2.

defn's motion to modify bond/body only arest warrant for failing to comply with BMP.  Argument by ADA Blais and Atty Bucher.  Bail set at $5,000 cash for the case.  Defn shall not be on the 400 block of W Mifflin St, Madison WI.  All othe rconditions previously set in the signature bond that was set on 9-25-2014 remain the same

$5,000/CASE
The court finds that cash bond is necessary to assure the defendant's appearance in court.  Cash bond is set in the amount of $5,000. (per case).  If the defendant posts case bail, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM as a condition of the defendant's release.  The defendant shall report to  DCBM by 10:00 AM on the business day following his release from jail.
If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for defendant's arrest and defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
- Defendant shall have no contact, direct or indirect, with Shelby P., Justine S., or William H.
- Defendant shall not be in the 300th, 400th, or 500th block of W Dayton St in Madison, Wisconsin.
- Defendant shall not be on King St in Madison, Wisconsin.
- Defendant shall not be at Madison's Bar in Madison, Wisconsin.
- Defendant shall not be in the 400 block of West Mifflin St., Madison, Wisconsin.
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
- Defendant shall reside with his father.
- Defendant shall have no firearms located within his residence.
